About This Game

Shooting down alien invaders never felt so good! In Cosmic Rocket Defender, use your rocket launcher to dodge bombardments from swarms of attackers, while blasting them out of the sky as they swoop down, strafe and attempt to dive bomb you out of existence. Hit 'em with your arsenal of rockets. Capture trophies, extras, and CASH. Upgrade your speed, rocket power, and shields. Quick reflexes wins the day in this Blast-o-rama. Destroy or be destroyed!


READ MORE

Posted: October 5
3min of game play
YouTube™ Video: 3min of Cosmic Rocket Defender - highlights 
Views: 15
the review for this game on steam http://steamcommunity.com/id/blinkdoggie/recommended/385630


This is a space invaders clone but with upgrades.
The game is less about avoiding shot and more about not being where they shoot because shots from 1/2 way or more down the board (all bosses) leave little to no time to doge.
Basics are move left and right to avoid attacks and shoot down the invaders from space.
Each level has more than one wave of invading aliens, and every 10th level you'll fight a boss.
You get cash from drops and beating levels to upgrade your trucks speed, rockets, addons (adds another weapon), armor, and Mbomb.
You'll lost 1 armor every time you get hit but if you continue you'll start with 2, this also applies to Mbomb when you use them but enemies do drop both, also shields.
You can continue as much as you like but if you stop you'll start from the 1st level again (no saving)
Read More

Ichigo Jam
1,144 products in account
3 reviews
Not Recommended
0.9 hrs on record
Posted: September 29
Not terrible, but not good either.
Lacking in variety - every level looks and plays very similarly.

The invisible enemies are very annoying - you can be left firing randomly into space wondering where the last enemy is who's preventing you finishing the level.

I also felt that the enemy bullets were too fast, not giving me time to react. Especially true on the boss levels - I have no idea how you're supposed to avoid getting hit by either of the bosses I saw (and they seem to have random timing on when they attack so you can't predict them either).

Oh, and it doesn't save your progress, despite giving you unlimited continues :(
Read More
